ETYMOLOGY: Compound of 'every' and 'one'. 'Every' ultimately derives from Old English 'ǣfre ǣlc' (ever each); 'one' from Old English 'ān'.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Every person; all people, often referring to all members of a specific group or the general public.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 所有的人；大家；每一个人（指群体中的所有成员）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Everyone needs to submit their report before the end of the day.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 每个人都需要在今天结束前提交报告。
